message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with social choice and voting rules, which are typically studied in the Game Theory (cs.GT) sub-category. The use of virtual votes and the presence of sybil attacks suggest a potential application of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) techniques. The security aspect of the problem, with the need to prevent fake/duplicate votes, points to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category. The study of the tradeoff between safety and liveness involves the analysis of algorithms and their performance, which falls under the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. Finally, the use of virtual votes to enforce the status quo can be seen as a form of social influence, which is studied in the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category.
